Approximate Message Passing

Stanford University, Fall 2017

A list of readings for this course

  • Approximate message passing algorithms for compressed sensing, PhD thesis by Arian Maleki
  • Graphical models concepts in compressed sensing, Andrea Montanari
  • Vector approximate message passing, Sundeep Rangan, Philip Schniter, Alyson Fletcher
  • Expectation Consistent Approximate Inference: Generalizations and Convergence, Alyson K. Fletcher, Mojtaba Sahraee-Ardakan, Sundeep Rangan, Philip Schniter
  • Inference for Generalized Linear Models via Alternating Directions and Bethe Free Energy Minimization, Sundeep Rangan, Alyson K. Fletcher, Philip Schniter, Ulugbek Kamilov
  • High Dimensional Robust M-Estimation: Asymptotic Variance via Approximate Message Passing, David Donoho, Andrea Montanari
  • Near-optimal matrix recovery from random linear measurements, Elad Romanov, Matan Gavish
  • The Likelihood Ratio Test in High-Dimensional Logistic Regression Is Asymptotically a Rescaled Chi-Square, Pragya Sur, Yuxin Chen, Emmanuel J. Cand√®s
